content.description:
Crouch start with a pair of small edges. From there, climb to the great lip, and mantle on top.

It looks like a possible sit start could be done for added difficulty and mileage.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spot wouldn't hurt. The problem's landing is great but finishes with a rock or two behind it.
content.location:
It shares the same start as

Galapagos

. It climbs the southwest face of Vonnegut.

content.description: Sit start with your choice of edge. From there, climb out through the edges, then traverse left and up along a good rail to reach a featured topout.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Vonnegut.

content.description:
Galapagos climbs out from under the Boulder's southwest face using big moves on great holds.

There are a lot of options with the sit start.  The start which I used began seated with a right hand crimp and a left hand undercling.  From there, work out and up slightly left to a pair of edges, set your feet, and fire up to a great, four finger pocket.  Then either continue straight up or bail out to the right.
content.protection: Pad and spot, good landing though.
content.location: This is on the southwest face of Vonnegut Boulder.

content.description:
An excellent problem and book! Breakfast of Champions ascends a short overhang via powerful movement on good stone over a great landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the obvious block. From there, work through a series of edge/bumps to reach the lip and subsequent finish (can either be done directly or by traversing right a few feet).
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the southeast face of Vonnegut.
